nodes.text: Internet of Things (IoT) enables home automation that can be remotely managed to improve convenience, efficiency, and quality of life
IoT connects appliances to sensors and the Internet enabling automatic device-to-device communication and remote control
IoT-based home automation provides specific benefits: better monitoring, time efficiency, cost savings, improved quality of life, smart environment control, and health monitoring
IoT architecture and communication protocols (Bluetooth/BLE, ZigBee, Z-Wave, Wi-Fi, Cellular, NFC, LoRaWAN) are key enablers for varied home and broader applications
Existing literature and prototypes demonstrate feasibility: WiFi-based and low-cost expandable IoT home automation prototypes have been implemented and evaluated
Security, privacy, user expertise gaps, and potential exploitation of non-expert users are significant challenges for widespread IoT adoption
Devices connected to sensors and Internet can be controlled remotely without human intervention, enabling automated operations
Device-to-device transmission improves procedural clarity and reduces repetitive human tasks, increasing efficiency
Monitoring devices and optimizing energy use via IoT leads to potential cost savings and resource optimization
IoT systems can support health monitoring (heart rate, blood pressure patterns) and assist elderly or disabled people in homes and hospitals

Different communication technologies trade off range, power consumption, data rate, cost, and suitability: e.g., BLE for low power wearables, LoRaWAN for low-power WAN, Wi-Fi for high data within LANs
Reviewed studies report implemented prototypes: a WiFi-based home automation prototype achieved remote appliance control and monitoring and some systems were low-cost and expandable
Privacy and security vulnerabilities and lack of user IT expertise limit IoT reliability and may hinder acceptance
IoT has broad application domains beyond homes including smart cities, industrial automation, environmental monitoring, and healthcare
Combining Artificial Intelligence with IoT can further enhance automation and user comfort
